title: Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415) Page Content ​​​The Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa. You might be able to apply for the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. What this visa lets you do Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. During your stay in Australia, you and your family must: comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws maintain adequate health insurance while you are in Australia meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia. Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. During your stay in Australia, you and your family must: comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws maintain adequate health insurance while you are in Australia meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia. Work in Australia Details ​​​​​​You must not: stop working for the employer who sponsored you work in a position or occupation that was not nominated in your visa application work for another person or for yourself while also working for your sponsoring employer. If your sponsor ends your employment, you must either: find another employer who is willing to sponsor you leave Australia within 28 days, or before your visa expires, whichever happens first. Family members Details Any family included on your visa must: enter Australia with, or after you leave Australia with, or before you continue to be a member of your family unit. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation Sponsors Details This information is for sponsors of workers on a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415). This visa is now closed to new applications. You cannot apply to sponsor someone for this visa You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations) to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored. How long the sponsorship lasts Details Your sponsorship period lasts for three years. New applications for a Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) do not require sponsorship. Sponsor obligations Details You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations: cooperate with inspectors tell us when certain events occur keep records provide records and information to the Minister not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen ensure the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity. You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent. Cooperate with inspectors Details You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under the Migration Act 1958 (the Act) who are investigating whether: a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with you have hired an illegal worker there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action. This obligation: starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases. Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to): providing access to premises producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe not preventing or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises. Keep records Details You must keep records that show you have complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person. You must keep a record of: any notification that you were required to make to us the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification. This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved. This obligation ends two years after both of the following: you are no longer an approved sponsor, and you are no longer sponsoring anyone. You do not need to keep any records for more than five years. Provide records and information to the Minister Details You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether: a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed, in the manner and timeframe requested by the department. We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that: you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor. This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences. This obligation ends two years after: your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and you no longer have a sponsored visa holder. Tell us when certain events occur Details You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring. Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include: the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor, relating to the person's address and contact details. This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences. This obligation ends two years after: your sponsorship or the work agreement ends, and you are no longer sponsoring anyone. Where to send a notice of an event or change You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below. By email (preferred): sponsor.notifications@homeaffairs.gov.au By registered post: Australian Capital Territory Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 717 Canberra ACT 2601 New South Wales Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 9984 Sydney NSW 2001 Queensland Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 9984 Brisbane Qld 4001 Northern Territory Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 864 Darwin NT 0801 South Australia Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 2399 Adelaide SA 5001 Tasmania Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 794 Hobart Tas. 7001 Victoria Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 241 Melbourne Vic. 3001 Western Australia Sponsor Monitoring Locked Bag 7 Northbridge WA 6865 Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity Details You must ensure that the person you have sponsored participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved. This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest): the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor the sponsored visa holder is granted another substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa) the sponsored visa holder has left Australia and the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect. Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person Details You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to: the recruitment of the person you sponsored becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor. This obligation: starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences ends on the following two events: you cease to be an approved sponsor or party to a work agreement you no longer have a sponsored visa holder. Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include: cost of sponsorship and nomination charges migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including: recruitment agent fees migration agent fees the cost of job advertising screening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checks salaries of recruitment or human resource staff the cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the position training of new staff responding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicants travel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia. Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen Details You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions. We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways: exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office. writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under the Migration Act 1958 . Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations. Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations Details If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions: Administrative Details you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled. Enforceable undertaking Details You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking. Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again. Civil Details we can issue an infringement notice of up to AUD10200 for a body corporate and AUD2040 for an individual for each failure. we can apply to a court for a civil penalty order of up to AUD51 000 for a corporation and AUD10200 for an individual for each failure. Other circumstances in which administrative action might be taken In addition, you could also have sanctions imposed if: The types of actions that could be taken depend on whether the sponsor is a standard business sponsor or has made a work agreement. If you have sponsored someone under a work agreement, we could suspend or terminate it in accordance with the clauses of the particular work agreement. you provide false or misleading information to us or the Migration Review Tribunal you no longer satisfy the criteria for approval as a sponsor or for variation of a term of that approval you have been found by a court or competent authority to have contravened a Commonwealth, state or territory law the person you have sponsored breaks a law relating to the licensing, registration or membership needed to work in the nominated position.

===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415)

Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415)
Page Content

​​​The Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa. You might be able to apply for theTemporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403).

​​​The Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa. You might be able to apply for the
Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403)
.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415). It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:
- comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
- maintainadequate health insurancewhile you are in Australia
maintain
adequate health insurance
while you are in Australia
- meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.
meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:
- comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
- maintainadequate health insurancewhile you are in Australia
maintain
adequate health insurance
while you are in Australia
- meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.
meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.

#### Work in Australia

Work in Australia
Details

​​​​​​You must not:

​​​​​​You must not:
- stop working for the employer who sponsored you
stop working for the employer who sponsored you
- work in a position or occupation that was not nominated in your visa application
work in a position or occupation that was not nominated in your visa application
- work for another person or for yourself while also working for your sponsoring employer.
work for another person or for yourself while also working for your sponsoring employer.

If your sponsor ends your employment, you must either:

If your sponsor ends your employment, you must either:
- find another employer who is willing to sponsor you
find another employer who is willing to sponsor you
- leave Australia within 28 days, or before your visa expires, whichever happens first.
leave Australia within 28 days, or before your visa expires, whichever happens first.

#### Family members

Family members
Details

Any family included on your visa must:

Any family included on your visa must:
- enter Australia with, or after you
enter Australia with, or after you
- leave Australia with, or before you
leave Australia with, or before you
- continue to be a member of your family unit.
continue to be a member of your family unit.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

## Sponsors

Sponsors
Details

This information is for sponsors of workers on a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415).

This information is for sponsors of workers on a Foreign Government Agency visa (subclass 415).

This visa is now closed to new applications. You cannot apply to sponsor someone for this visa.

This visa is now closed to new applications. You cannot apply to sponsor someone for this visa
.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)
to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored.

### How long the sponsorship lasts

How long the sponsorship lasts
Details

Your sponsorship period lasts for three years.

Your sponsorship period lasts for three years.

New applications for aTemporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403)do not require sponsorship.

New applications for a
Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403)
do not require sponsorship.

### Sponsor obligations

Sponsor obligations
Details

You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations:

You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations:
- cooperate with inspectors
cooperate with inspectors
- tell us when certain events occur
tell us when certain events occur
- keep records
keep records
- provide records and information to the Minister
provide records and information to the Minister
- not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
- pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
- ensure the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity.
ensure the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity.

You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent.

You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent.

#### Cooperate with inspectors

Cooperate with inspectors
Details

You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under theMigration Act 1958(the Act) who are investigating whether:

You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under the
Migration Act 1958
(the Act) who are investigating whether:
- a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with
a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with
- you have hired an illegal worker
you have hired an illegal worker
- there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action.
there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action.

This obligation:

This obligation:
- starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
- ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends  or work agreement ceases.
ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends  or work agreement ceases.

Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to):

Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to):
- providing access to premises
providing access to premises
- producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe
producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe
- not preventing  or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents
not preventing  or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents
- providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises.
providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises.

#### Keep records

Keep records
Details

You must keep records that show you have complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person.

You must keep records that show you have complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person.

You must keep a record of:

You must keep a record of:
- any notification that you were required to make to us
any notification that you were required to make to us
- the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification.
the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification.

This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved.

This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved.

This obligation ends two years after both of the following:

This obligation ends two years after both of the following:
- you are no longer an approved sponsor, and
you are no longer an approved sponsor, and
- you are no longer sponsoring anyone.
you are no longer sponsoring anyone.

You do not need to keep any records for more than five years.

You do not need to keep any records for more than five years.

#### Provide records and information to the Minister

Provide records and information to the Minister
Details

You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether:

You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether:
- a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and
a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and
- determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed,in the manner and timeframe requested by the department.
determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed,
in the manner and timeframe requested by the department.

We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that:

We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that:
- you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law
you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law
- you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor.
you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences.

This obligation ends two years after:

This obligation ends two years after:
- your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and
your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and
- you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.

#### Tell us when certain events occur

Tell us when certain events occur
Details

You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring.Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include:

You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring.
Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include:
- the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and
the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and
- a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor, relating to the person's address and contact details.
a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor, relating to the person's address and contact details.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences.

This obligation ends two years after:

This obligation ends two years after:
- your sponsorship or the work agreement ends, and
your sponsorship or the work agreement ends, and
- you are no longer sponsoring anyone.
you are no longer sponsoring anyone.

Where to send a notice of an event or change

Where to send a notice of an event or change

You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below.

You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below.

By email(preferred):sponsor.notifications@homeaffairs.gov.au

By email
(preferred):
sponsor.notifications@homeaffairs.gov.au

By registered post:

#### Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity

Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity
Details

You must ensure that the person you have sponsored participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved.

You must ensure that the person you have sponsored participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved.

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):
- the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor
the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor
- the sponsored visa holder is granted another  substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa)
the sponsored visa holder is granted another  substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa)
- the sponsored visa holder  has left Australia and  the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.
the sponsored visa holder  has left Australia and  the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.

#### Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person

Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
Details

You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to:

You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to:
- the recruitment of  the person you sponsored
the recruitment of  the person you sponsored
- becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor.
becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor.

This obligation:

This obligation:
- starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
- ends on the following two events:you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreementyou no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
ends on the following two events:
- you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreement
you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreement
- you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.

Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include:

Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include:
- cost of sponsorship and nomination charges
cost of sponsorship and nomination charges
- migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications
migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications
- administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including:recruitment agent feesmigration agent feesthe cost of job advertisingscreening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checkssalaries of recruitment or human resource staffthe cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the positiontraining of new staffresponding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicantstravel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia.
administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including:
- recruitment agent fees
recruitment agent fees
- migration agent fees
migration agent fees
- the cost of job advertising
the cost of job advertising
- screening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checks
screening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checks
- salaries of recruitment or human resource staff
salaries of recruitment or human resource staff
- the cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the position
the cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the position
- training of new staff
training of new staff
- responding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicants
responding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicants
- travel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia.
travel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia.

#### Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen

Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Details

You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions.

You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions.

We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways:

We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways:
- exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office.
exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office.
- writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information
writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information
- site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice
site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice

Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under theMigration Act 1958. Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations.

Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under the
Migration Act 1958
. Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations.

### Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations

Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations
Details

If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions:

If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions:

#### Administrative

Administrative
Details
- you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time
you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time
- you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one
you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one
- all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled.
all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled.

#### Enforceable undertaking

Enforceable undertaking
Details

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

#### Civil

Civil
Details
- we can issue an infringement notice of up to AUD10200 for a body corporate and AUD2040 for an individual for each failure.
